name: Henry

services.title: Mobile app development
services.description: I have extensive experience developing Android/iOS mobile apps using the React Native.

services.title: Web development
services.description: I have a long history of web development including working with WordPress and Drupal but nowadays I have a preference for using React and Next.js

services.title: Game development
services.description: I'm still relatively new to game development however I have gained a lot of confidence working with the Unreal and Unity game engines and am on the look out for good ideas to work/collab on.

aboutpara: Shiba inus are indeed very cute and I wish I had one.

resume.description: JavaScript/TypeScript developer primarily using React/React Native/Node.js.

experiences.bullets: I work for the dating app SALT, as one of two developers, across the MERN (Mongo, Express, React/React Native, Node.js) stack. My focus is on the frontend, primarily on the React Native mobile app, but I do extensive work developing the Node.js backend, internal admin panel (React) and am currently completely rebuilding the website using Next.js

At Careplanner, I worked on the then newest iteration of the mobile app, which provides an appointment rostering functionality enabling carers to check in and out of appointments. The app uses React Native and consumes a GraphQL API, provided by AWS AppSync, which links it to the CarePlanner REST API.

experiences.position: Software Developer at Active Inspiration Technologies
experiences.bullets: For Active Inspiration I primarily worked on the Fuell React Native app, however I also worked across the stack, developing the Fuell backend using Node.js/Parse Server. Active Inspiration had many clients for whom I developed various solutions, using technologies including React, Node.js, GraphQL and Next.js.

experiences.position: Junior Software Developer  at DYRNAN Communications
experiences.bullets: Worked on the frontend of a React application

experiences.position: Freelance Web Developer at Candour Creative
experiences.bullets: Candour Creative outsourced some of their development work to me, which involved developing the website nicksweeney.co.uk using WordPress as a platform to create a custom CMS (PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, CSS).
For my year in industry during my Computer Science degree, I worked for WebCurl, a web development agency based in Oxford, where I helped develop websites using Drupal (PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, CSS).

education.universityName: Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) Computer Science at Oxford Brookes University
education.universityPara: A 4-year course (including a year in industry) covering Java with a focus on OOP and other modules, including Python, C/C++, JavaScript and C#. My course also involved a teaching module, for which I spent a week as a teaching assistant, helping to teach Python and Scratch at a secondary school. In my final year, as part of my final year project, I developed a maths game called Equation Dragger, that is currently available on the Google Play Store.
